item.description:
Greetings, GMC Volunteers and Friends! It’s that time again…

This is your invitation to join the fun at Green Mountain Club headquarters for our 16th Annual Snowshoe Festival on Saturday, February 4 from 8:30-3:00.

This year’s event will feature a full schedule of beginner, intermediate, and advanced snowshoe trips as featured in GMC’s Snowshoeing in Vermont: A Guide to the Best Winter Hikes.

Like last year, full-day admission is $8.00 for members, $10.00 for nonmembers, and free for kids under 12. This year’s event will include a winter party from 3:00-5:00 with live music, food, and a chance to win great raffle prizes.

Nonmembers who join on the day of the event will receive the membership discount as well as a free Snowshoe book. What a deal!

In addition to saving the date for this event, we hope that you will consider lending a hand as an on-site volunteer or trip leader! We are looking for volunteers to guide hikes, sell tickets, coordinate parking, lead activities for kids and feed hungry snowshoers.

We hope to see a mix of friendly Snowshoe Fest devotees from years past and some fresh new faces to make this year’s event successful. We are looking for helpers for half the day (shifts run from 8:00-12:00 and 12:00-3:00) in each of the following areas: Parking – 3-4 volunteers Greeters – 4 volunteers Raffle tickets – 1-2 volunteers Membership – 2 volunteers Floater – 1 volunteer Registration – 6 volunteers Facilities Coordinator – 1 volunteer Education Program Reps – 2 volunteers Kids’ Activities Leaders – 1-2 volunteers Volunteer Registration – 2 volunteers On-site Trip Leaders – 4-6 volunteers Off-site Trip Leaders* – 40 volunteers (1/2 with first aid, 2 per trip) Hot Beverages and Snacks – 4 volunteers *

We require that at least one co-leader for every hike has Wilderness First-Aid certification, which includes First Aid and CPR training.

The cost to registered Snowshoe Fest trip leaders is $95, which is half price. CPR Training is also offered that weekend for an additional $35. Please reply to this email or call me at the phone number below to sign up. Thanks!

We look forward to seeing and/or working with you! Mari Zagarins Director of Membership and Volunteer Services Green Mountain Club 4711 Waterbury-Stowe Road Waterbury Center, VT 05677 Phone: 802-244-7037 x24 Fax: 802-244-5867

 

The mission of the Green Mountain Club is to make the Vermont Mountains play a larger part in the life of the people by protecting and maintaining the Long Trail System and fostering, through education, the stewardship of Vermont's hiking trails and mountains.
